explains: adj. 迷信的；迷信引起的，没有充分根据的

sentences.en: Jean was extremely superstitious and believed the colour green brought bad luck.
sentences.cn: 琼极端迷信，认为绿色会带来厄运。

sentences.en: This was an argument of tremendous force in that superstitious day.
sentences.cn: 在那个迷信的年代，这是一个非常有力的证据。

sentences.en: Yet oddly enough, to be born on the 13th of the month is not regarded with any fear at all, which just shows how irrational we are in our superstitious beliefs.
sentences.cn: 然而奇怪的是，人们对出生在这个月的13号一点也不担心，这恰恰表明我们的迷信是多么不理性。
